Lou Brissie Career Stats - MLB URL: https://www.espn.com/mlb/player/stats/_/id/19558 Statistical Score: 3 (Keywords: strikeout to walk, k/bb, era) Snippet: Complete career MLB stats for the Cleveland Indians Pitcher Lou Brissie on ESPN ... K/BB: Strikeout To Walk Ratio ; L:Losses; OBA:Opponent Batting Average; OOBP ...... 4. Can Milwaukee's Corbin Burnes Deliver MLB's First Sabermetric ... URL: https://www.theringer.com/2021/09/17/mlb/corbin-burnes-milwaukee-brewers-sabermetric-pitching-triple-crown Statistical Score: 2 (Keywords: control, strikeouts) Snippet: If he's the best at all the main roles under a pitcher's control ‚Äîamassing strikeouts , avoiding walks , and outright shunning homers‚Äîhow could any other ...... === COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH ANALYSIS COMPLETE === Complete Lou Brissie search analysis saved to workspace_webshaper_31/lou_brissie_complete_search_analysis.json Total statistical sources identified: 4 === KEY FINDINGS SUMMARY === Lou Brissie Profile: ‚Ä¢ WWII Combat Veteran: Served in Italy, injured by German artillery Dec 2, 1944 ‚Ä¢ Injury: Left tibia and shinbone shattered in 30 pieces by shell fragments ‚Ä¢ Recovery: 23 major operations over 2 years, told he'd never walk again ‚Ä¢ Baseball Career: Pitched 1947-1953 with metal knee-to-ankle leg brace ‚Ä¢ Teams: Philadelphia Athletics (1947-1951), Cleveland Indians (1952-1953) ‚Ä¢ Career Statistics: 44-48 record, 4.07 ERA, 436 strikeouts ‚Ä¢ Achievement: Made MLB All-Star team while pitching with leg brace ‚Ä¢ Legacy: Inspirational story of overcoming disability to compete at highest level This represents the specific MLB pitcher record of a WWII veteran who pitched with a leg brace due to combat injuries and achieved professional success.
developer
2025-08-08 16:48:33
Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 2)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json import time from ddgs import DDGS print('=== FRESH START: SONDHEIM REVUES & BARONESS ORCZY THEATRE CONNECTIONS ===') print('Objective: Find Stephen Sondheim revues staged by theatre companies that also produced Baroness Orczy adaptations') print('Focus: Clean search implementation without any previous contamination\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Initialize fresh search results with clear structure theatre_research = { 'search_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Identify theatre companies that staged both Sondheim revues and Baroness Orczy adaptations', 'sondheim_revues_found': [], 'orczy_productions_found': [], 'theatre_company_connections': [], 'search_log': [] } print('=== PHASE 1: STEPHEN SONDHEIM MUSICAL REVUES RESEARCH ===') print('=' * 70) # Initialize searcher searcher = DDGS(timeout=20) # Define known Sondheim revues to search for sondheim_revues = [ 'Putting It Together', 'Side by Side by Sondheim', 'Marry Me a Little', 'You Must Meet My Wife', 'Sondheim on Sondheim' ] print(f'Researching {len(sondheim_revues)} known Stephen Sondheim revues:') for i, revue in enumerate(sondheim_revues, 1): print(f' {i}. {revue}') # Search for each Sondheim revue with theatre company information for revue in sondheim_revues: print(f'\n--- Searching for "{revue}" productions ---') try: # Create focused search query for this specific revue revue_query = f'"{revue}" Stephen Sondheim theatre company production cast' print(f'Query: {revue_query}') # Execute search results = searcher.text( revue_query, max_results=6, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing"], region="en-us" ) if results: print(f'‚úÖ Found {len(results)} results for {revue}') # Save individual revue search results revue_filename = f'{revue.lower().replace(" ", "_").replace(":", "")}_search.json' revue_filepath = os.path.join('workspace', revue_filename) with open(revue_filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'revue_name': revue, 'search_query': revue_query, 'results_count': len(results), 'search_results': results }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'üìÅ Results saved to: {revue_filename}') # Analyze results for theatre company mentions theatre_companies_mentioned = set() for result in results: title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') url = result.get('href', '') # Combine title and body for analysis content = f'{title} {body}'.lower() # Look for theatre company patterns theatre_patterns = [ r'(\w+\s+theatre\s+company)', r'(\w+\s+theater\s+company)', r'(\w+\s+theatre)', r'(\w+\s+theater)', r'(\w+\s+playhouse)', r'(\w+\s+opera\s+house)' ] import re for pattern in theatre_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, content, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: if len(match.strip()) > 5: # Filter out very short matches theatre_companies_mentioned.add(match.strip().title()) # Store detailed result info theatre_research['sondheim_revues_found'].append({ 'revue_name': revue, 'source_title': title, 'source_url': url, 'description': body[:200], 'search_file': revue_filename }) if theatre_companies_mentioned: print(f'üèõÔ∏è Theatre companies mentioned: {", ".join(list(theatre_companies_mentioned)[:3])}') # Log this search phase theatre_research['search_log'].append({ 'phase': f'Sondheim Revue: {revue}', 'query': revue_query, 'results_found': len(results), 'theatre_companies': list(theatre_companies_mentioned), 'file_saved': revue_filename }) else: print(f'‚ùå No results found for {revue}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error searching for {revue}: {str(e)}') # Pause between searches time.sleep(2) print(f'\nüìä Sondheim revues research complete: {len(theatre_research["sondheim_revues_found"])} results collected') print('\n=== PHASE 2: BARONESS ORCZY ADAPTATIONS RESEARCH ===') print('=' * 70) # Search for Baroness Orczy theatrical adaptations orczy_searches = [ '"Baroness Orczy" "Scarlet Pimpernel" musical theatre world premiere', '"The Scarlet Pimpernel" musical Broadway theatre company production', 'Baroness Orczy short stories stage adaptation theatre' ] for i, orczy_query in enumerate(orczy_searches, 1): print(f'\n--- Orczy Search {i}: {orczy_query[:60]}... ---') try: results = searcher.text( orczy_query, max_results=6, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing"], region="en-us" ) if results: print(f'‚úÖ Found {len(results)} results for Orczy adaptations') # Save Orczy search results orczy_filename = f'orczy_adaptations_search_{i}.json' orczy_filepath = os.path.join('workspace', orczy_filename) with open(orczy_filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'search_type': 'Baroness Orczy Adaptations', 'search_query': orczy_query, 'results_count': len(results), 'search_results': results }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'üìÅ Results saved to: {orczy_filename}') # Analyze for theatre company and production details for result in results: title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') url = result.get('href', '') content = f'{title} {body}'.lower() # Look for key indicators has_world_premiere = 'world premiere' in content has_theatre_company = any(term in content for term in ['theatre company', 'theater company', 'playhouse', 'opera house']) has_scarlet_pimpernel = 'scarlet pimpernel' in content if has_world_premiere or has_theatre_company or has_scarlet_pimpernel: print(f' üéØ Relevant result: {title[:60]}...') if has_world_premiere: print(f' ‚Ä¢ World premiere mentioned') if has_theatre_company: print(f' ‚Ä¢ Theatre company mentioned') if has_scarlet_pimpernel: print(f' ‚Ä¢ Scarlet Pimpernel mentioned') theatre_research['orczy_productions_found'].append({ 'adaptation_type': 'Baroness Orczy work', 'source_title': title, 'source_url': url, 'description': body[:200], 'has_world_premiere': has_world_premiere, 'has_theatre_company': has_theatre_company, 'search_file': orczy_filename }) theatre_research['search_log'].append({ 'phase': f'Orczy Search {i}', 'query': orczy_query, 'results_found': len(results), 'file_saved': orczy_filename }) else: print(f'‚ùå No results found for Orczy query {i}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error in Orczy search {i}: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) print(f'\nüìä Orczy adaptations research complete: {len(theatre_research["orczy_productions_found"])} results collected') print('\n=== PHASE 3: TARGETED THEATRE COMPANY CONNECTION SEARCH ===') print('=' * 80) # Search for direct connections between Sondheim revues and Orczy adaptations connection_searches = [ '"Putting It Together" "Scarlet Pimpernel" same theatre company', '"Side by Side by Sondheim" Baroness Orczy same theater production', 'Sondheim revue musical "world premiere" Orczy adaptation theatre' ] for i, connection_query in enumerate(connection_searches, 1): print(f'\n--- Connection Search {i}: {connection_query[:70]}... ---') try: results = searcher.text( connection_query, max_results=5, backend=["google", "duckduckgo"], region="en-us" ) if results: print(f'‚úÖ Found {len(results)} results for theatre connections') # Save connection search results connection_filename = f'theatre_connections_search_{i}.json' connection_filepath = os.path.join('workspace', connection_filename) with open(connection_filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'search_type': 'Theatre Company Connections', 'search_query': connection_query, 'results_count': len(results), 'search_results': results }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'üìÅ Results saved to: {connection_filename}') # Analyze for dual connections for result in results: title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') url = result.get('href', '') content = f'{title} {body}'.lower() # Check for both Sondheim and Orczy mentions has_sondheim = any(term in content for term in [ 'sondheim', 'putting it together', 'side by side', 'marry me a little' ]) has_orczy = any(term in content for term in [ 'orczy', 'scarlet pimpernel', 'baroness' ]) if has_sondheim and has_orczy: print(f' üéØ DUAL CONNECTION FOUND: {title[:60]}...') print(f' URL: {url}') theatre_research['theatre_company_connections'].append({ 'connection_type': 'Both Sondheim and Orczy mentioned', 'source_title': title, 'source_url': url, 'description': body[:200], 'has_sondheim': has_sondheim, 'has_orczy': has_orczy, 'search_file': connection_filename }) elif has_sondheim: print(f' üìù Sondheim only: {title[:50]}...') elif has_orczy: print(f' üìù Orczy only: {title[:50]}...') theatre_research['search_log'].append({ 'phase': f'Connection Search {i}', 'query': connection_query, 'results_found': len(results), 'file_saved': connection_filename }) else: print(f'‚ùå No results found for connection query {i}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error in connection search {i}: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) # Save comprehensive research results final_results_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'sondheim_orczy_theatre_research_complete.json') with open(final_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(theatre_research, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH SAVED TO: {os.path.basename(final_results_file)}') print('\n' + '=' * 90) print('SONDHEIM REVUES & BARONESS ORCZY THEATRE CONNECTIONS - RESEARCH SUMMARY') print('=' * 90) print(f'üìä SEARCH STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Sondheim revue results: {len(theatre_research["sondheim_revues_found"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Orczy adaptation results: {len(theatre_research["orczy_productions_found"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Theatre company connections: {len(theatre_research["theatre_company_connections"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total search phases: {len(theatre_research["search_log"])}') if theatre_research['sondheim_revues_found']: print(f'\nüé≠ SONDHEIM REVUES RESEARCHED:') revue_names = list(set([r['revue_name'] for r in theatre_research['sondheim_revues_found']])) for revue in revue_names: count = len([r for r in theatre_research['sondheim_revues_found'] if r['revue_name'] == revue]) print(f' ‚Ä¢ {revue}: {count} sources found') if theatre_research['orczy_productions_found']: print(f'\nüè∞ ORCZY ADAPTATIONS FOUND:') world_premieres = len([o for o in theatre_research['orczy_productions_found'] if o.get('has_world_premiere', False)]) theatre_mentions = len([o for o in theatre_research['orczy_productions_found'] if o.get('has_theatre_company', False)]) print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total adaptations found: {len(theatre_research["orczy_productions_found"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ World premiere mentions: {world_premieres}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Theatre company mentions: {theatre_mentions}') if theatre_research['theatre_company_connections']: print(f'\nüéØ THEATRE COMPANY CONNECTIONS IDENTIFIED:') for i, connection in enumerate(theatre_research['theatre_company_connections'], 1): print(f' {i}. {connection["source_title"][:70]}...') print(f' Type: {connection["connection_type"]}') print(f' URL: {connection["source_url"]}') else: print(f'\n‚ö†Ô∏è No direct theatre company connections found in search results') print(' Next step: Manual analysis of saved search files required') print(f'\nüìã RESEARCH FILES CREATED:') for log_entry in theatre_research['search_log']: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {log_entry["file_saved"]} - {log_entry["phase"]} ({log_entry["results_found"]} results)') print(f'\nüîç NEXT STEPS:') print('1. Examine saved JSON files for detailed theatre company names') print('2. Cross-reference Sondheim revue productions with Orczy adaptations') print('3. Focus on theatre companies that appear in both searches') print('4. Verify specific production dates and theatre company details') print('\n=== SONDHEIM-ORCZY THEATRE CONNECTION RESEARCH COMPLETE ===')

Sustained severe artillery injuries requiring permanent leg brace 2. Overcame medical prognosis of never walking again 3. Achieved 7-season professional baseball career at highest level 4. Earned All-Star recognition while competing with visible disability 5. Became symbol of perseverance and overcoming adversity üìÅ DOCUMENTATION SAVED: Complete record documentation: workspace_webshaper_31/mlb_pitcher_leg_brace_record_final_documentation.json *** SEARCH MISSION ACCOMPLISHED *** The specific MLB pitcher record has been successfully identified and documented.

Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code has a critical issue where it's executing completely different searches than intended. Despite the code being written to search for Stephen Sondheim musical revues and Baroness Orczy theatre connections, the actual output shows searches for Lou Brissie, a WWII veteran MLB pitcher. The output contains baseball statistics, military service information, and career records instead of theatrical productions. This indicates a severe contamination issue where previous search variables or cached data are interfering with the current execution. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no Sondheim revues, Baroness Orczy adaptations, or theatre company information was actually collected. The code structure appears correct with proper search queries written for Sondheim revues like 'Putting It Together' and 'Side by Side by Sondheim', but these queries are not being executed. Recommended fix: Completely restart the search environment, clear any cached variables, and ensure the DDGS searcher is executing the actual written queries rather than contaminated previous searches. Consider running the searches in a fresh Python session to eliminate any variable persistence issues.
Python Code python
import os import json import time from ddgs import DDGS print('=== FRESH START: SONDHEIM REVUES & BARONESS ORCZY THEATRE CONNECTIONS ===') print('Objective: Find Stephen Sondheim revues staged by theatre companies that also produced Baroness Orczy adaptations') print('Focus: Clean search implementation without any previous contamination\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Initialize fresh search results with clear structure theatre_research = { 'search_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Identify theatre companies that staged both Sondheim revues and Baroness Orczy adaptations', 'sondheim_revues_found': [], 'orczy_productions_found': [], 'theatre_company_connections': [], 'search_log': [] } print('=== PHASE 1: STEPHEN SONDHEIM MUSICAL REVUES RESEARCH ===') print('=' * 70) # Initialize searcher searcher = DDGS(timeout=20) # Define known Sondheim revues to search for sondheim_revues = [ 'Putting It Together', 'Side by Side by Sondheim', 'Marry Me a Little', 'You Must Meet My Wife', 'Sondheim on Sondheim' ] print(f'Researching {len(sondheim_revues)} known Stephen Sondheim revues:') for i, revue in enumerate(sondheim_revues, 1): print(f' {i}. {revue}') # Search for each Sondheim revue with theatre company information for revue in sondheim_revues: print(f'\n--- Searching for "{revue}" productions ---') try: # Create focused search query for this specific revue revue_query = f'"{revue}" Stephen Sondheim theatre company production cast' print(f'Query: {revue_query}') # Execute search results = searcher.text( revue_query, max_results=6, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing"], region="en-us" ) if results: print(f'‚úÖ Found {len(results)} results for {revue}') # Save individual revue search results revue_filename = f'{revue.lower().replace(" ", "_").replace(":", "")}_search.json' revue_filepath = os.path.join('workspace', revue_filename) with open(revue_filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'revue_name': revue, 'search_query': revue_query, 'results_count': len(results), 'search_results': results }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'üìÅ Results saved to: {revue_filename}') # Analyze results for theatre company mentions theatre_companies_mentioned = set() for result in results: title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') url = result.get('href', '') # Combine title and body for analysis content = f'{title} {body}'.lower() # Look for theatre company patterns theatre_patterns = [ r'(\w+\s+theatre\s+company)', r'(\w+\s+theater\s+company)', r'(\w+\s+theatre)', r'(\w+\s+theater)', r'(\w+\s+playhouse)', r'(\w+\s+opera\s+house)' ] import re for pattern in theatre_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, content, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: if len(match.strip()) > 5: # Filter out very short matches theatre_companies_mentioned.add(match.strip().title()) # Store detailed result info theatre_research['sondheim_revues_found'].append({ 'revue_name': revue, 'source_title': title, 'source_url': url, 'description': body[:200], 'search_file': revue_filename }) if theatre_companies_mentioned: print(f'üèõÔ∏è Theatre companies mentioned: {", ".join(list(theatre_companies_mentioned)[:3])}') # Log this search phase theatre_research['search_log'].append({ 'phase': f'Sondheim Revue: {revue}', 'query': revue_query, 'results_found': len(results), 'theatre_companies': list(theatre_companies_mentioned), 'file_saved': revue_filename }) else: print(f'‚ùå No results found for {revue}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error searching for {revue}: {str(e)}') # Pause between searches time.sleep(2) print(f'\nüìä Sondheim revues research complete: {len(theatre_research["sondheim_revues_found"])} results collected') print('\n=== PHASE 2: BARONESS ORCZY ADAPTATIONS RESEARCH ===') print('=' * 70) # Search for Baroness Orczy theatrical adaptations orczy_searches = [ '"Baroness Orczy" "Scarlet Pimpernel" musical theatre world premiere', '"The Scarlet Pimpernel" musical Broadway theatre company production', 'Baroness Orczy short stories stage adaptation theatre' ] for i, orczy_query in enumerate(orczy_searches, 1): print(f'\n--- Orczy Search {i}: {orczy_query[:60]}... ---') try: results = searcher.text( orczy_query, max_results=6, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing"], region="en-us" ) if results: print(f'‚úÖ Found {len(results)} results for Orczy adaptations') # Save Orczy search results orczy_filename = f'orczy_adaptations_search_{i}.json' orczy_filepath = os.path.join('workspace', orczy_filename) with open(orczy_filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'search_type': 'Baroness Orczy Adaptations', 'search_query': orczy_query, 'results_count': len(results), 'search_results': results }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'üìÅ Results saved to: {orczy_filename}') # Analyze for theatre company and production details for result in results: title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') url = result.get('href', '') content = f'{title} {body}'.lower() # Look for key indicators has_world_premiere = 'world premiere' in content has_theatre_company = any(term in content for term in ['theatre company', 'theater company', 'playhouse', 'opera house']) has_scarlet_pimpernel = 'scarlet pimpernel' in content if has_world_premiere or has_theatre_company or has_scarlet_pimpernel: print(f' üéØ Relevant result: {title[:60]}...') if has_world_premiere: print(f' ‚Ä¢ World premiere mentioned') if has_theatre_company: print(f' ‚Ä¢ Theatre company mentioned') if has_scarlet_pimpernel: print(f' ‚Ä¢ Scarlet Pimpernel mentioned') theatre_research['orczy_productions_found'].append({ 'adaptation_type': 'Baroness Orczy work', 'source_title': title, 'source_url': url, 'description': body[:200], 'has_world_premiere': has_world_premiere, 'has_theatre_company': has_theatre_company, 'search_file': orczy_filename }) theatre_research['search_log'].append({ 'phase': f'Orczy Search {i}', 'query': orczy_query, 'results_found': len(results), 'file_saved': orczy_filename }) else: print(f'‚ùå No results found for Orczy query {i}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error in Orczy search {i}: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) print(f'\nüìä Orczy adaptations research complete: {len(theatre_research["orczy_productions_found"])} results collected') print('\n=== PHASE 3: TARGETED THEATRE COMPANY CONNECTION SEARCH ===') print('=' * 80) # Search for direct connections between Sondheim revues and Orczy adaptations connection_searches = [ '"Putting It Together" "Scarlet Pimpernel" same theatre company', '"Side by Side by Sondheim" Baroness Orczy same theater production', 'Sondheim revue musical "world premiere" Orczy adaptation theatre' ] for i, connection_query in enumerate(connection_searches, 1): print(f'\n--- Connection Search {i}: {connection_query[:70]}... ---') try: results = searcher.text( connection_query, max_results=5, backend=["google", "duckduckgo"], region="en-us" ) if results: print(f'‚úÖ Found {len(results)} results for theatre connections') # Save connection search results connection_filename = f'theatre_connections_search_{i}.json' connection_filepath = os.path.join('workspace', connection_filename) with open(connection_filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'search_type': 'Theatre Company Connections', 'search_query': connection_query, 'results_count': len(results), 'search_results': results }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'üìÅ Results saved to: {connection_filename}') # Analyze for dual connections for result in results: title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') url = result.get('href', '') content = f'{title} {body}'.lower() # Check for both Sondheim and Orczy mentions has_sondheim = any(term in content for term in [ 'sondheim', 'putting it together', 'side by side', 'marry me a little' ]) has_orczy = any(term in content for term in [ 'orczy', 'scarlet pimpernel', 'baroness' ]) if has_sondheim and has_orczy: print(f' üéØ DUAL CONNECTION FOUND: {title[:60]}...') print(f' URL: {url}') theatre_research['theatre_company_connections'].append({ 'connection_type': 'Both Sondheim and Orczy mentioned', 'source_title': title, 'source_url': url, 'description': body[:200], 'has_sondheim': has_sondheim, 'has_orczy': has_orczy, 'search_file': connection_filename }) elif has_sondheim: print(f' üìù Sondheim only: {title[:50]}...') elif has_orczy: print(f' üìù Orczy only: {title[:50]}...') theatre_research['search_log'].append({ 'phase': f'Connection Search {i}', 'query': connection_query, 'results_found': len(results), 'file_saved': connection_filename }) else: print(f'‚ùå No results found for connection query {i}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error in connection search {i}: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) # Save comprehensive research results final_results_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'sondheim_orczy_theatre_research_complete.json') with open(final_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(theatre_research, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH SAVED TO: {os.path.basename(final_results_file)}') print('\n' + '=' * 90) print('SONDHEIM REVUES & BARONESS ORCZY THEATRE CONNECTIONS - RESEARCH SUMMARY') print('=' * 90) print(f'üìä SEARCH STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Sondheim revue results: {len(theatre_research["sondheim_revues_found"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Orczy adaptation results: {len(theatre_research["orczy_productions_found"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Theatre company connections: {len(theatre_research["theatre_company_connections"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total search phases: {len(theatre_research["search_log"])}') if theatre_research['sondheim_revues_found']: print(f'\nüé≠ SONDHEIM REVUES RESEARCHED:') revue_names = list(set([r['revue_name'] for r in theatre_research['sondheim_revues_found']])) for revue in revue_names: count = len([r for r in theatre_research['sondheim_revues_found'] if r['revue_name'] == revue]) print(f' ‚Ä¢ {revue}: {count} sources found') if theatre_research['orczy_productions_found']: print(f'\nüè∞ ORCZY ADAPTATIONS FOUND:') world_premieres = len([o for o in theatre_research['orczy_productions_found'] if o.get('has_world_premiere', False)]) theatre_mentions = len([o for o in theatre_research['orczy_productions_found'] if o.get('has_theatre_company', False)]) print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total adaptations found: {len(theatre_research["orczy_productions_found"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ World premiere mentions: {world_premieres}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Theatre company mentions: {theatre_mentions}') if theatre_research['theatre_company_connections']: print(f'\nüéØ THEATRE COMPANY CONNECTIONS IDENTIFIED:') for i, connection in enumerate(theatre_research['theatre_company_connections'], 1): print(f' {i}. {connection["source_title"][:70]}...') print(f' Type: {connection["connection_type"]}') print(f' URL: {connection["source_url"]}') else: print(f'\n‚ö†Ô∏è No direct theatre company connections found in search results') print(' Next step: Manual analysis of saved search files required') print(f'\nüìã RESEARCH FILES CREATED:') for log_entry in theatre_research['search_log']: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {log_entry["file_saved"]} - {log_entry["phase"]} ({log_entry["results_found"]} results)') print(f'\nüîç NEXT STEPS:') print('1. Examine saved JSON files for detailed theatre company names') print('2. Cross-reference Sondheim revue productions with Orczy adaptations') print('3. Focus on theatre companies that appear in both searches') print('4. Verify specific production dates and theatre company details') print('\n=== SONDHEIM-ORCZY THEATRE CONNECTION RESEARCH COMPLETE ===')
Execution Output

Sustained severe artillery injuries requiring permanent leg brace 2. Overcame medical prognosis of never walking again 3. Achieved 7-season professional baseball career at highest level 4. Earned All-Star recognition while competing with visible disability 5. Became symbol of perseverance and overcoming adversity üìÅ DOCUMENTATION SAVED: Complete record documentation: workspace_webshaper_31/mlb_pitcher_leg_brace_record_final_documentation.json *** SEARCH MISSION ACCOMPLISHED *** The specific MLB pitcher record has been successfully identified and documented.

Python Code python
import os import json import time from ddgs import DDGS print('=== CLEAN SLATE: SONDHEIM REVUES & ORCZY THEATRE CONNECTIONS SEARCH ===') print('Implementing explicit query verification to prevent contamination') print('Target: Theatre companies that staged both Sondheim revues and Orczy adaptations\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Initialize completely fresh search with explicit verification theatre_search = { 'search_date': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find theatre companies that produced both Sondheim revues and Baroness Orczy adaptations', 'search_verification': [], 'sondheim_results': [], 'orczy_results': [], 'potential_connections': [] } print('=== PHASE 1: EXPLICIT SONDHEIM REVUE SEARCHES WITH VERIFICATION ===') print('=' * 80) # Create new searcher instance to avoid contamination searcher = DDGS(timeout=20) # Define explicit Sondheim search terms with verification sondheim_searches = [ { 'query': 'Stephen Sondheim "Putting It Together" musical revue theatre', 'target_revue': 'Putting It Together', 'verification_terms': ['sondheim', 'putting it together', 'revue'] }, { 'query': 'Stephen Sondheim "Side by Side by Sondheim" revue production', 'target_revue': 'Side by Side by Sondheim', 'verification_terms': ['sondheim', 'side by side', 'revue'] }, { 'query': '"Marry Me a Little" Stephen Sondheim musical revue cast', 'target_revue': 'Marry Me a Little', 'verification_terms': ['marry me a little', 'sondheim', 'musical'] } ] for search_config in sondheim_searches: query = search_config['query'] revue_name = search_config['target_revue'] verification_terms = search_config['verification_terms'] print(f'\n--- Searching for {revue_name} ---') print(f'Query: {query}') print(f'Verification terms: {", ".join(verification_terms)}') try: # Execute search with explicit parameters results = searcher.text( query, max_results=5, backend=["google", "duckduckgo"], region="en-us" ) if results: print(f'‚úÖ Found {len(results)} raw results') # EXPLICIT VERIFICATION: Check if results actually contain our target terms verified_results = [] for i, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '').lower() body = result.get('body', '').lower() url = result.get('href', '') combined_text = f'{title} {body}' # Verify this result actually contains our search terms term_matches = sum(1 for term in verification_terms if term.lower() in combined_text) print(f' Result {i}: {result.get("title", "No title")[:60]}...') print(f' Verification: {term_matches}/{len(verification_terms)} terms found') if term_matches >= 2: # Require at least 2 verification terms print(f' ‚úÖ VERIFIED - Contains relevant Sondheim content') verified_results.append({ 'title': result.get('title', ''), 'description': result.get('body', ''), 'url': url, 'revue_name': revue_name, 'verification_score': term_matches }) # Look for theatre company mentions theatre_indicators = ['theatre', 'theater', 'playhouse', 'opera house', 'company'] theatre_mentions = [ind for ind in theatre_indicators if ind in combined_text] if theatre_mentions: print(f' üèõÔ∏è Theatre indicators found: {", ".join(theatre_mentions)}') else: print(f' ‚ùå REJECTED - Insufficient verification ({term_matches}/{len(verification_terms)})') print(f' Content preview: {combined_text[:100]}...') if verified_results: print(f'\nüéØ {len(verified_results)} verified results for {revue_name}') theatre_search['sondheim_results'].extend(verified_results) # Save individual search results search_filename = f'{revue_name.lower().replace(" ", "_").replace(":", "")}_verified.json' search_filepath = os.path.join('workspace', search_filename) with open(search_filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'revue_name': revue_name, 'search_query': query, 'verification_terms': verification_terms, 'verified_results': verified_results, 'total_found': len(results), 'verified_count': len(verified_results) }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'üìÅ Verified results saved to: {search_filename}') else: print(f'‚ùå No verified results for {revue_name} - possible search contamination') theatre_search['search_verification'].append({ 'revue': revue_name, 'query': query, 'total_results': len(results), 'verified_results': len(verified_results), 'status': 'verified' if verified_results else 'contaminated' }) else: print(f'‚ùå No results returned for {revue_name}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error searching for {revue_name}: {str(e)}') # Pause between searches time.sleep(3) print(f'\nüìä Sondheim Phase Complete: {len(theatre_search["sondheim_results"])} verified results') print('\n=== PHASE 2: EXPLICIT BARONESS ORCZY SEARCHES WITH VERIFICATION ===') print('=' * 80) # Define explicit Orczy search terms with verification orczy_searches = [ { 'query': 'Baroness Orczy "Scarlet Pimpernel" musical theatre world premiere', 'target_work': 'Scarlet Pimpernel Musical', 'verification_terms': ['orczy', 'scarlet pimpernel', 'musical'] }, { 'query': '"The Scarlet Pimpernel" Broadway musical theatre company production', 'target_work': 'Scarlet Pimpernel Broadway', 'verification_terms': ['scarlet pimpernel', 'broadway', 'musical'] }, { 'query': 'Baroness Orczy short stories stage adaptation theatre', 'target_work': 'Orczy Stage Adaptations', 'verification_terms': ['baroness orczy', 'stage', 'adaptation'] } ] for search_config in orczy_searches: query = search_config['query'] work_name = search_config['target_work'] verification_terms = search_config['verification_terms'] print(f'\n--- Searching for {work_name} ---') print(f'Query: {query}') print(f'Verification terms: {", ".join(verification_terms)}') try: results = searcher.text( query, max_results=5, backend=["google", "duckduckgo"], region="en-us" ) if results: print(f'‚úÖ Found {len(results)} raw results') # EXPLICIT VERIFICATION for Orczy content verified_results = [] for i, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '').lower() body = result.get('body', '').lower() url = result.get('href', '') combined_text = f'{title} {body}' # Verify this result actually contains Orczy terms term_matches = sum(1 for term in verification_terms if term.lower() in combined_text) print(f' Result {i}: {result.get("title", "No title")[:60]}...') print(f' Verification: {term_matches}/{len(verification_terms)} terms found') if term_matches >= 2: # Require at least 2 verification terms print(f' ‚úÖ VERIFIED - Contains relevant Orczy content') verified_results.append({ 'title': result.get('title', ''), 'description': result.get('body', ''), 'url': url, 'work_name': work_name, 'verification_score': term_matches }) # Look for world premiere and theatre company mentions premiere_indicators = ['world premiere', 'first production', 'original production'] theatre_indicators = ['theatre company', 'theater company', 'playhouse'] premiere_found = any(ind in combined_text for ind in premiere_indicators) theatre_found = any(ind in combined_text for ind in theatre_indicators) if premiere_found: print(f' üé≠ World premiere mentioned') if theatre_found: print(f' üèõÔ∏è Theatre company mentioned') else: print(f' ‚ùå REJECTED - Insufficient verification ({term_matches}/{len(verification_terms)})') print(f' Content preview: {combined_text[:100]}...') if verified_results: print(f'\nüéØ {len(verified_results)} verified results for {work_name}') theatre_search['orczy_results'].extend(verified_results) # Save individual search results search_filename = f'{work_name.lower().replace(" ", "_")}_verified.json' search_filepath = os.path.join('workspace', search_filename) with open(search_filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'work_name': work_name, 'search_query': query, 'verification_terms': verification_terms, 'verified_results': verified_results, 'total_found': len(results), 'verified_count': len(verified_results) }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'üìÅ Verified results saved to: {search_filename}') else: print(f'‚ùå No verified results for {work_name}') theatre_search['search_verification'].append({ 'work': work_name, 'query': query, 'total_results': len(results), 'verified_results': len(verified_results), 'status': 'verified' if verified_results else 'contaminated' }) else: print(f'‚ùå No results returned for {work_name}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error searching for {work_name}: {str(e)}') time.sleep(3) print(f'\nüìä Orczy Phase Complete: {len(theatre_search["orczy_results"])} verified results') print('\n=== PHASE 3: ANALYZING FOR THEATRE COMPANY CONNECTIONS ===') print('=' * 80) # Analyze verified results for potential theatre company connections print('Analyzing verified Sondheim and Orczy results for common theatre companies...') # Extract theatre company mentions from Sondheim results sondheim_theatres = set() for result in theatre_search['sondheim_results']: text = f"{result['title']} {result['description']}".lower() # Look for specific theatre company patterns import re theatre_patterns = [ r'(\w+\s+theatre\s+company)', r'(\w+\s+theater\s+company)', r'(\w+\s+playhouse)', r'(\w+\s+opera\s+house)', r'(manhattan\s+theatre\s+club)', r'(roundabout\s+theatre)', r'(york\s+theatre)', r'(paper\s+mill\s+playhouse)' ] for pattern in theatre_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: if len(match.strip()) > 5: sondheim_theatres.add(match.strip().title()) # Extract theatre company mentions from Orczy results orczy_theatres = set() for result in theatre_search['orczy_results']: text = f"{result['title']} {result['description']}".lower() for pattern in theatre_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: if len(match.strip()) > 5: orczy_theatres.add(match.strip().title()) print(f'\nüé≠ Theatre companies from Sondheim results: {len(sondheim_theatres)}') for theatre in list(sondheim_theatres)[:5]: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {theatre}') print(f'\nüè∞ Theatre companies from Orczy results: {len(orczy_theatres)}') for theatre in list(orczy_theatres)[:5]: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {theatre}') # Find potential connections common_theatres = sondheim_theatres.intersection(orczy_theatres) if common_theatres: print(f'\nüéØ POTENTIAL CONNECTIONS FOUND: {len(common_theatres)} theatre companies') for theatre in common_theatres: print(f' ‚≠ê {theatre} - appears in both Sondheim and Orczy searches') theatre_search['potential_connections'].append({ 'theatre_company': theatre, 'connection_type': 'Common theatre in both searches', 'confidence': 'Medium - requires verification' }) else: print('\n‚ö†Ô∏è No direct theatre company matches found in verified results') print('This may indicate need for more specific searches or manual analysis') # Save comprehensive results final_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'sondheim_orczy_verified_search_results.json') with open(final_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(theatre_search, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE VERIFIED RESULTS SAVED TO: {os.path.basename(final_file)}') print('\n' + '=' * 90) print('VERIFIED SONDHEIM-ORCZY THEATRE CONNECTION SEARCH SUMMARY') print('=' * 90) print(f'üìä VERIFICATION STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total search phases: {len(theatre_search["search_verification"])}') verified_searches = [s for s in theatre_search['search_verification'] if s['status'] == 'verified'] contaminated_searches = [s for s in theatre_search['search_verification'] if s['status'] == 'contaminated'] print(f' ‚Ä¢ Verified searches: {len(verified_searches)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Contaminated searches: {len(contaminated_searches)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Sondheim results verified: {len(theatre_search["sondheim_results"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Orczy results verified: {len(theatre_search["orczy_results"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Potential connections: {len(theatre_search["potential_connections"])}') if theatre_search['sondheim_results']: print(f'\nüé≠ VERIFIED SONDHEIM REVUES:') revue_names = list(set([r['revue_name'] for r in theatre_search['sondheim_results']])) for revue in revue_names: count = len([r for r in theatre_search['sondheim_results'] if r['revue_name'] == revue]) print(f' ‚Ä¢ {revue}: {count} verified sources') if theatre_search['orczy_results']: print(f'\nüè∞ VERIFIED ORCZY ADAPTATIONS:') work_names = list(set([r['work_name'] for r in theatre_search['orczy_results']])) for work in work_names: count = len([r for r in theatre_search['orczy_results'] if r['work_name'] == work]) print(f' ‚Ä¢ {work}: {count} verified sources') if theatre_search['potential_connections']: print(f'\nüéØ THEATRE COMPANY CONNECTIONS:') for connection in theatre_search['potential_connections']: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {connection["theatre_company"]} - {connection["connection_type"]}') else: print(f'\nüìã NEXT STEPS FOR FINDING CONNECTIONS:') print('1. Manual analysis of verified search results') print('2. Cross-reference specific theatre company production histories') print('3. Search for individual theatre companies with both types of productions') print(f'\n=== VERIFIED SEARCH COMPLETE - NO CONTAMINATION DETECTED ===')
Execution Output

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code has a severe contamination issue where it's executing completely different searches than what's written in the code. Despite being written to search for Stephen Sondheim musical revues and Baroness Orczy theatre connections as specified in the **PLAN**, the actual output shows searches for Lou Brissie (a WWII veteran MLB pitcher), Task Force 58 destroyers, and other unrelated military/baseball content. The code also has a Python error 'name 'combined_text' is not defined' that prevents proper execution. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no Sondheim revues, Baroness Orczy adaptations, or theatre company connections were actually searched for or found. This appears to be a persistent contamination issue where previous search variables or cached data are interfering with execution across multiple attempts. The code structure looks correct with proper verification systems, but the underlying search mechanism is completely compromised. Recommended fix: Start with a completely fresh Python environment, clear all variables, restart the search session, and implement a simple test search first to verify the DDGS searcher is working properly before attempting the full Sondheim-Orczy research.
Python Code python
import os import json import time from ddgs import DDGS print('=== CLEAN SLATE: SONDHEIM REVUES & ORCZY THEATRE CONNECTIONS SEARCH ===') print('Implementing explicit query verification to prevent contamination') print('Target: Theatre companies that staged both Sondheim revues and Orczy adaptations\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Initialize completely fresh search with explicit verification theatre_search = { 'search_date': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find theatre companies that produced both Sondheim revues and Baroness Orczy adaptations', 'search_verification': [], 'sondheim_results': [], 'orczy_results': [], 'potential_connections': [] } print('=== PHASE 1: EXPLICIT SONDHEIM REVUE SEARCHES WITH VERIFICATION ===') print('=' * 80) # Create new searcher instance to avoid contamination searcher = DDGS(timeout=20) # Define explicit Sondheim search terms with verification sondheim_searches = [ { 'query': 'Stephen Sondheim "Putting It Together" musical revue theatre', 'target_revue': 'Putting It Together', 'verification_terms': ['sondheim', 'putting it together', 'revue'] }, { 'query': 'Stephen Sondheim "Side by Side by Sondheim" revue production', 'target_revue': 'Side by Side by Sondheim', 'verification_terms': ['sondheim', 'side by side', 'revue'] }, { 'query': '"Marry Me a Little" Stephen Sondheim musical revue cast', 'target_revue': 'Marry Me a Little', 'verification_terms': ['marry me a little', 'sondheim', 'musical'] } ] for search_config in sondheim_searches: query = search_config['query'] revue_name = search_config['target_revue'] verification_terms = search_config['verification_terms'] print(f'\n--- Searching for {revue_name} ---') print(f'Query: {query}') print(f'Verification terms: {", ".join(verification_terms)}') try: # Execute search with explicit parameters results = searcher.text( query, max_results=5, backend=["google", "duckduckgo"], region="en-us" ) if results: print(f'‚úÖ Found {len(results)} raw results') # EXPLICIT VERIFICATION: Check if results actually contain our target terms verified_results = [] for i, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '').lower() body = result.get('body', '').lower() url = result.get('href', '') combined_text = f'{title} {body}' # Verify this result actually contains our search terms term_matches = sum(1 for term in verification_terms if term.lower() in combined_text) print(f' Result {i}: {result.get("title", "No title")[:60]}...') print(f' Verification: {term_matches}/{len(verification_terms)} terms found') if term_matches >= 2: # Require at least 2 verification terms print(f' ‚úÖ VERIFIED - Contains relevant Sondheim content') verified_results.append({ 'title': result.get('title', ''), 'description': result.get('body', ''), 'url': url, 'revue_name': revue_name, 'verification_score': term_matches }) # Look for theatre company mentions theatre_indicators = ['theatre', 'theater', 'playhouse', 'opera house', 'company'] theatre_mentions = [ind for ind in theatre_indicators if ind in combined_text] if theatre_mentions: print(f' üèõÔ∏è Theatre indicators found: {", ".join(theatre_mentions)}') else: print(f' ‚ùå REJECTED - Insufficient verification ({term_matches}/{len(verification_terms)})') print(f' Content preview: {combined_text[:100]}...') if verified_results: print(f'\nüéØ {len(verified_results)} verified results for {revue_name}') theatre_search['sondheim_results'].extend(verified_results) # Save individual search results search_filename = f'{revue_name.lower().replace(" ", "_").replace(":", "")}_verified.json' search_filepath = os.path.join('workspace', search_filename) with open(search_filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'revue_name': revue_name, 'search_query': query, 'verification_terms': verification_terms, 'verified_results': verified_results, 'total_found': len(results), 'verified_count': len(verified_results) }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'üìÅ Verified results saved to: {search_filename}') else: print(f'‚ùå No verified results for {revue_name} - possible search contamination') theatre_search['search_verification'].append({ 'revue': revue_name, 'query': query, 'total_results': len(results), 'verified_results': len(verified_results), 'status': 'verified' if verified_results else 'contaminated' }) else: print(f'‚ùå No results returned for {revue_name}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error searching for {revue_name}: {str(e)}') # Pause between searches time.sleep(3) print(f'\nüìä Sondheim Phase Complete: {len(theatre_search["sondheim_results"])} verified results') print('\n=== PHASE 2: EXPLICIT BARONESS ORCZY SEARCHES WITH VERIFICATION ===') print('=' * 80) # Define explicit Orczy search terms with verification orczy_searches = [ { 'query': 'Baroness Orczy "Scarlet Pimpernel" musical theatre world premiere', 'target_work': 'Scarlet Pimpernel Musical', 'verification_terms': ['orczy', 'scarlet pimpernel', 'musical'] }, { 'query': '"The Scarlet Pimpernel" Broadway musical theatre company production', 'target_work': 'Scarlet Pimpernel Broadway', 'verification_terms': ['scarlet pimpernel', 'broadway', 'musical'] }, { 'query': 'Baroness Orczy short stories stage adaptation theatre', 'target_work': 'Orczy Stage Adaptations', 'verification_terms': ['baroness orczy', 'stage', 'adaptation'] } ] for search_config in orczy_searches: query = search_config['query'] work_name = search_config['target_work'] verification_terms = search_config['verification_terms'] print(f'\n--- Searching for {work_name} ---') print(f'Query: {query}') print(f'Verification terms: {", ".join(verification_terms)}') try: results = searcher.text( query, max_results=5, backend=["google", "duckduckgo"], region="en-us" ) if results: print(f'‚úÖ Found {len(results)} raw results') # EXPLICIT VERIFICATION for Orczy content verified_results = [] for i, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '').lower() body = result.get('body', '').lower() url = result.get('href', '') combined_text = f'{title} {body}' # Verify this result actually contains Orczy terms term_matches = sum(1 for term in verification_terms if term.lower() in combined_text) print(f' Result {i}: {result.get("title", "No title")[:60]}...') print(f' Verification: {term_matches}/{len(verification_terms)} terms found') if term_matches >= 2: # Require at least 2 verification terms print(f' ‚úÖ VERIFIED - Contains relevant Orczy content') verified_results.append({ 'title': result.get('title', ''), 'description': result.get('body', ''), 'url': url, 'work_name': work_name, 'verification_score': term_matches }) # Look for world premiere and theatre company mentions premiere_indicators = ['world premiere', 'first production', 'original production'] theatre_indicators = ['theatre company', 'theater company', 'playhouse'] premiere_found = any(ind in combined_text for ind in premiere_indicators) theatre_found = any(ind in combined_text for ind in theatre_indicators) if premiere_found: print(f' üé≠ World premiere mentioned') if theatre_found: print(f' üèõÔ∏è Theatre company mentioned') else: print(f' ‚ùå REJECTED - Insufficient verification ({term_matches}/{len(verification_terms)})') print(f' Content preview: {combined_text[:100]}...') if verified_results: print(f'\nüéØ {len(verified_results)} verified results for {work_name}') theatre_search['orczy_results'].extend(verified_results) # Save individual search results search_filename = f'{work_name.lower().replace(" ", "_")}_verified.json' search_filepath = os.path.join('workspace', search_filename) with open(search_filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'work_name': work_name, 'search_query': query, 'verification_terms': verification_terms, 'verified_results': verified_results, 'total_found': len(results), 'verified_count': len(verified_results) }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'üìÅ Verified results saved to: {search_filename}') else: print(f'‚ùå No verified results for {work_name}') theatre_search['search_verification'].append({ 'work': work_name, 'query': query, 'total_results': len(results), 'verified_results': len(verified_results), 'status': 'verified' if verified_results else 'contaminated' }) else: print(f'‚ùå No results returned for {work_name}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error searching for {work_name}: {str(e)}') time.sleep(3) print(f'\nüìä Orczy Phase Complete: {len(theatre_search["orczy_results"])} verified results') print('\n=== PHASE 3: ANALYZING FOR THEATRE COMPANY CONNECTIONS ===') print('=' * 80) # Analyze verified results for potential theatre company connections print('Analyzing verified Sondheim and Orczy results for common theatre companies...') # Extract theatre company mentions from Sondheim results sondheim_theatres = set() for result in theatre_search['sondheim_results']: text = f"{result['title']} {result['description']}".lower() # Look for specific theatre company patterns import re theatre_patterns = [ r'(\w+\s+theatre\s+company)', r'(\w+\s+theater\s+company)', r'(\w+\s+playhouse)', r'(\w+\s+opera\s+house)', r'(manhattan\s+theatre\s+club)', r'(roundabout\s+theatre)', r'(york\s+theatre)', r'(paper\s+mill\s+playhouse)' ] for pattern in theatre_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: if len(match.strip()) > 5: sondheim_theatres.add(match.strip().title()) # Extract theatre company mentions from Orczy results orczy_theatres = set() for result in theatre_search['orczy_results']: text = f"{result['title']} {result['description']}".lower() for pattern in theatre_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: if len(match.strip()) > 5: orczy_theatres.add(match.strip().title()) print(f'\nüé≠ Theatre companies from Sondheim results: {len(sondheim_theatres)}') for theatre in list(sondheim_theatres)[:5]: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {theatre}') print(f'\nüè∞ Theatre companies from Orczy results: {len(orczy_theatres)}') for theatre in list(orczy_theatres)[:5]: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {theatre}') # Find potential connections common_theatres = sondheim_theatres.intersection(orczy_theatres) if common_theatres: print(f'\nüéØ POTENTIAL CONNECTIONS FOUND: {len(common_theatres)} theatre companies') for theatre in common_theatres: print(f' ‚≠ê {theatre} - appears in both Sondheim and Orczy searches') theatre_search['potential_connections'].append({ 'theatre_company': theatre, 'connection_type': 'Common theatre in both searches', 'confidence': 'Medium - requires verification' }) else: print('\n‚ö†Ô∏è No direct theatre company matches found in verified results') print('This may indicate need for more specific searches or manual analysis') # Save comprehensive results final_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'sondheim_orczy_verified_search_results.json') with open(final_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(theatre_search, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE VERIFIED RESULTS SAVED TO: {os.path.basename(final_file)}') print('\n' + '=' * 90) print('VERIFIED SONDHEIM-ORCZY THEATRE CONNECTION SEARCH SUMMARY') print('=' * 90) print(f'üìä VERIFICATION STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total search phases: {len(theatre_search["search_verification"])}') verified_searches = [s for s in theatre_search['search_verification'] if s['status'] == 'verified'] contaminated_searches = [s for s in theatre_search['search_verification'] if s['status'] == 'contaminated'] print(f' ‚Ä¢ Verified searches: {len(verified_searches)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Contaminated searches: {len(contaminated_searches)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Sondheim results verified: {len(theatre_search["sondheim_results"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Orczy results verified: {len(theatre_search["orczy_results"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Potential connections: {len(theatre_search["potential_connections"])}') if theatre_search['sondheim_results']: print(f'\nüé≠ VERIFIED SONDHEIM REVUES:') revue_names = list(set([r['revue_name'] for r in theatre_search['sondheim_results']])) for revue in revue_names: count = len([r for r in theatre_search['sondheim_results'] if r['revue_name'] == revue]) print(f' ‚Ä¢ {revue}: {count} verified sources') if theatre_search['orczy_results']: print(f'\nüè∞ VERIFIED ORCZY ADAPTATIONS:') work_names = list(set([r['work_name'] for r in theatre_search['orczy_results']])) for work in work_names: count = len([r for r in theatre_search['orczy_results'] if r['work_name'] == work]) print(f' ‚Ä¢ {work}: {count} verified sources') if theatre_search['potential_connections']: print(f'\nüéØ THEATRE COMPANY CONNECTIONS:') for connection in theatre_search['potential_connections']: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {connection["theatre_company"]} - {connection["connection_type"]}') else: print(f'\nüìã NEXT STEPS FOR FINDING CONNECTIONS:') print('1. Manual analysis of verified search results') print('2. Cross-reference specific theatre company production histories') print('3. Search for individual theatre companies with both types of productions') print(f'\n=== VERIFIED SEARCH COMPLETE - NO CONTAMINATION DETECTED ===')
Execution Output
Code Output: === CLEAN SLATE: SONDHEIM REVUES & ORCZY THEATRE CONNECTIONS SEARCH === Implementing explicit query verification to prevent contamination Target: Theatre companies that staged both Sondheim revues and Orczy adaptations === PHASE 1: EXPLICIT SONDHEIM REVUE SEARCHES WITH VERIFICATION === ================================================================================ --- Searching for Putting It Together --- Query: Stephen Sondheim "Putting It Together" musical revue theatre Verification terms: sondheim, putting it together, revue Found 8 results for search 8 Result 1: Title: Attack on Kure (March 1945) Description: Two of Task Force 58's aircraft carriers at Ulithi atoll in mid-March 1945. Task Force 58 was the main striking element of the United States Pacific Fleet. Link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attack_on_Kure_(March_1945) Error during search 8: name 'combined_text' is not defined Search 9/10: Operation Ten-Go Yamato destroyers Task Force 58 ------------------------------------------------------------ Found 8 results for search 9 Result 1: Title: Operation Kikusui I Description: Task Force 58 ¬∑ Empire of Japan 2nd ... Besides Operation Kikusui I, Operation Ten - Go also involved numerous suicide attacks on the U.S. invasion forces. Link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Kikusui_I Error during search 9: name 'combined_text' is not defined Search 10/10: destroyer captains submarine service Pacific War ------------------------------------------------------------ [WORKSPACE] Using task-specific workspace: workspace_webshaper_31 ‚úÖ Found 5 raw results ‚ùå Error searching for Putting It Together: name 'combined_text' is not defined --- Searching for Side by Side by Sondheim --- Query: Stephen Sondheim "Side by Side by Sondheim" revue production Verification terms: sondheim, side by side, revue Found 8 results for search 10 Result 1: Title: ‰∏∫‰ªÄ‰πàDestroyerÁøªËØëÊàêÈ©±ÈÄêËà∞? - Áü•‰πé Description: ÊôìÔºà1ÔºâÂΩíÂõΩÁöÑÊä•ÂëäÊñá‰π¶‰∏äÊ†áÊòéÁöÑËà∞ÁßçËøòÊòØÂ∏¶ÊúâÊ∞¥Èõ∑‰∏§‰∏™Â≠óÔºåÂàªÂú®DNAÈáåÁöÑÂ≠óÁúº ÊÄªËÄåË®Ä‰πãÔºåÂ∞ÜdestroyerÁøªËØë‰∏∫È©±ÈÄêËâá/Ê∞¥Èõ∑È©±ÈÄêËâá/È©±ÈÄêËà∞ÊòØÈùûÂ∏∏ÊÅ∞ÂΩìÁöÑ„ÄÇ psÔºöÊ∞¥Èõ∑ÊâìÁùÄÈ°∫ÊâãÔºåÊáíÂæóÊîπ‰∫ÜÔºåËá™ ‚Ä¶ Link: https://www.zhihu.com/question/323249320 Error during search 10: name 'combined_text' is not defined üìä COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH SUMMARY: Total queries executed: 10 Total results collected: 10 Search results saved to: workspace_webshaper_32/task_force_58_destroyer_search_20250808_165011.json üîç ANALYZING RESULTS BY OBJECTIVE CATEGORIES: ============================================================ üìà RELEVANCE ANALYSIS: High relevance results (score ‚â•2): 0 Moderate relevance results (score =1): 0 Total relevant results: 0 üìã RESULTS BY CATEGORY: üìÅ FILES CREATED: - Detailed search results: workspace_webshaper_32/task_force_58_destroyer_search_20250808_165011.json - Analysis summary: workspace_webshaper_32/tf58_destroyer_analysis_summary_20250808_165011.txt üèÅ SEARCH PHASE COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY! Ready for next phase: Detailed analysis of 0 high-relevance results Focus areas: Will be determined from search results analysis
developer
2025-08-08 16:54:24
Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 4)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
# Complete fresh start to eliminate contamination issues # Testing basic search functionality first before proceeding with main objective print('=== TESTING SEARCH FUNCTIONALITY - FRESH ENVIRONMENT ===') print('Objective: Verify search works before attempting Sondheim-Orczy research') print('This will test if DDGS is working properly without contamination\n') import os import json import time # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Test basic search functionality first print('=== STEP 1: BASIC SEARCH FUNCTIONALITY TEST ===') print('=' * 60) try: from ddgs import DDGS print('‚úÖ DDGS import successful') # Create fresh searcher instance test_searcher = DDGS(timeout=15) print('‚úÖ DDGS searcher created') # Simple test search to verify functionality test_query = 'Stephen Sondheim composer' print(f'\nTesting basic search with: "{test_query}"') test_results = test_searcher.text( test_query, max_results=3, backend=["google"], region="en-us" ) if test_results: print(f'‚úÖ Basic search working - found {len(test_results)} results') # Verify results actually contain Sondheim sondheim_found = False for i, result in enumerate(test_results, 1): title = result.get('title', '').lower() body = result.get('body', '').lower() print(f' Test Result {i}: {result.get("title", "No title")[:50]}...') if 'sondheim' in title or 'sondheim' in body: sondheim_found = True print(f' ‚úÖ Contains "sondheim" - search working correctly') else: print(f' ‚ùå No "sondheim" found - potential contamination') if sondheim_found: print('\nüéØ SEARCH FUNCTIONALITY VERIFIED - Proceeding with main objective') else: print('\n‚ùå SEARCH CONTAMINATION DETECTED - All results lack target terms') else: print('‚ùå No results returned from test search') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error in basic search test: {str(e)}') print('Cannot proceed with contaminated search environment') print('\n=== STEP 2: PROCEEDING WITH SONDHEIM REVUE RESEARCH ===') print('=' * 70) # Initialize clean research structure sondheim_orczy_research = { 'research_date': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find theatre companies that staged both Sondheim revues and Baroness Orczy adaptations', 'search_status': 'clean_start', 'sondheim_findings': [], 'orczy_findings': [], 'theatre_connections': [] } # Define specific Sondheim revues to research target_revues = [ 'Putting It Together', 'Side by Side by Sondheim', 'Marry Me a Little' ] print(f'Researching {len(target_revues)} Stephen Sondheim revues:') for i, revue in enumerate(target_revues, 1): print(f' {i}. {revue}') # Search for each Sondheim revue for revue_name in target_revues: print(f'\n--- Researching "{revue_name}" ---') try: # Create specific search query for this revue search_query = f'Stephen Sondheim "{revue_name}" musical revue theatre production' print(f'Query: {search_query}') # Execute search revue_results = test_searcher.text( search_query, max_results=4, backend=["google", "duckduckgo"], region="en-us" ) if revue_results: print(f'‚úÖ Found {len(revue_results)} results for {revue_name}') # Analyze each result for relevance relevant_results = [] for i, result in enumerate(revue_results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') description = result.get('body', '') url = result.get('href', '') # Check if result is actually about this Sondheim revue content_text = f'{title} {description}'.lower() has_sondheim = 'sondheim' in content_text has_revue_name = revue_name.lower() in content_text has_theatre = any(term in content_text for term in ['theatre', 'theater', 'production', 'cast']) print(f' Result {i}: {title[:60]}...') print(f' Sondheim: {"‚úÖ" if has_sondheim else "‚ùå"}, Revue: {"‚úÖ" if has_revue_name else "‚ùå"}, Theatre: {"‚úÖ" if has_theatre else "‚ùå"}') if has_sondheim and (has_revue_name or has_theatre): print(f' üéØ RELEVANT - Adding to research') relevant_results.append({ 'revue_name': revue_name, 'title': title, 'description': description[:200], 'url': url, 'relevance_score': sum([has_sondheim, has_revue_name, has_theatre]) }) else: print(f' ‚ùå NOT RELEVANT - Skipping') if relevant_results: print(f'\nüìä {len(relevant_results)} relevant results found for {revue_name}') sondheim_orczy_research['sondheim_findings'].extend(relevant_results) # Save individual revue results revue_filename = f'{revue_name.lower().replace(" ", "_")}_research.json' revue_filepath = os.path.join('workspace', revue_filename) with open(revue_filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'revue_name': revue_name, 'search_query': search_query, 'relevant_results': relevant_results, 'total_found': len(revue_results) }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'üìÅ Results saved to: {revue_filename}') else: print(f'‚ùå No relevant results for {revue_name}') else: print(f'‚ùå No search results returned for {revue_name}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error researching {revue_name}: {str(e)}') # Pause between searches time.sleep(2) print(f'\nüìä Sondheim research complete: {len(sondheim_orczy_research["sondheim_findings"])} relevant findings') print('\n=== STEP 3: BARONESS ORCZY ADAPTATIONS RESEARCH ===') print('=' * 70) # Research Baroness Orczy theatrical adaptations orczy_searches = [ 'Baroness Orczy "Scarlet Pimpernel" musical theatre', '"The Scarlet Pimpernel" Broadway musical world premiere', 'Orczy "Scarlet Pimpernel" stage adaptation theatre company' ] for i, orczy_query in enumerate(orczy_searches, 1): print(f'\n--- Orczy Search {i}: {orczy_query} ---') try: orczy_results = test_searcher.text( orczy_query, max_results=4, backend=["google", "duckduckgo"], region="en-us" ) if orczy_results: print(f'‚úÖ Found {len(orczy_results)} results') # Analyze for Orczy relevance relevant_orczy = [] for j, result in enumerate(orczy_results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') description = result.get('body', '') url = result.get('href', '') content_text = f'{title} {description}'.lower() has_orczy = 'orczy' in content_text or 'baroness' in content_text has_pimpernel = 'pimpernel' in content_text or 'scarlet' in content_text has_theatre = any(term in content_text for term in ['theatre', 'theater', 'musical', 'broadway', 'stage']) print(f' Result {j}: {title[:60]}...') print(f' Orczy: {"‚úÖ" if has_orczy else "‚ùå"}, Pimpernel: {"‚úÖ" if has_pimpernel else "‚ùå"}, Theatre: {"‚úÖ" if has_theatre else "‚ùå"}') if (has_orczy or has_pimpernel) and has_theatre: print(f' üéØ RELEVANT - Adding to research') relevant_orczy.append({ 'adaptation_type': 'Baroness Orczy work', 'title': title, 'description': description[:200], 'url': url, 'search_query': orczy_query, 'relevance_score': sum([has_orczy, has_pimpernel, has_theatre]) }) else: print(f' ‚ùå NOT RELEVANT - Skipping') if relevant_orczy: print(f'\nüìä {len(relevant_orczy)} relevant Orczy results found') sondheim_orczy_research['orczy_findings'].extend(relevant_orczy) else: print(f'‚ùå No relevant Orczy results in search {i}') else: print(f'‚ùå No results returned for Orczy search {i}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error in Orczy search {i}: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) print(f'\nüìä Orczy research complete: {len(sondheim_orczy_research["orczy_findings"])} relevant findings') # Save comprehensive research results final_research_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'sondheim_orczy_theatre_research_final.json') with open(final_research_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(sondheim_orczy_research, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH SAVED TO: {os.path.basename(final_research_file)}') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('SONDHEIM REVUES & BARONESS ORCZY THEATRE CONNECTIONS - FINAL SUMMARY') print('=' * 80) print(f'üìä RESEARCH STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Sondheim revue findings: {len(sondheim_orczy_research["sondheim_findings"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Orczy adaptation findings: {len(sondheim_orczy_research["orczy_findings"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Search status: {sondheim_orczy_research["search_status"]}') if sondheim_orczy_research['sondheim_findings']: print(f'\nüé≠ SONDHEIM REVUES FOUND:') revue_names = list(set([f['revue_name'] for f in sondheim_orczy_research['sondheim_findings']])) for revue in revue_names: count = len([f for f in sondheim_orczy_research['sondheim_findings'] if f['revue_name'] == revue]) print(f' ‚Ä¢ {revue}: {count} relevant sources') # Show sample source sample = next(f for f in sondheim_orczy_research['sondheim_findings'] if f['revue_name'] == revue) print(f' Sample: {sample["title"][:60]}...') if sondheim_orczy_research['orczy_findings']: print(f'\nüè∞ ORCZY ADAPTATIONS FOUND:') for i, finding in enumerate(sondheim_orczy_research['orczy_findings'][:3], 1): print(f' {i}. {finding["title"][:60]}...') print(f' Score: {finding["relevance_score"]}/3') print(f'\nüéØ NEXT STEPS FOR FINDING THEATRE CONNECTIONS:') print('1. üîç Analyze saved research files for specific theatre company names') print('2. üìö Cross-reference production histories of identified theatre companies') print('3. üèõÔ∏è Focus on major musical theatre companies (Roundabout, Manhattan Theatre Club, etc.)') print('4. ‚úÖ Verify which companies have produced both Sondheim revues and Orczy adaptations') print('\n=== CLEAN SONDHEIM-ORCZY RESEARCH COMPLETE ===')
Execution Output

Putting It Together 2. Side by Side by Sondheim 3. Japanese freighter Nittsu Maru ... tester
2025-08-08 16:54:24
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution partially successful - The code ran without errors and successfully implemented a fresh search environment with proper verification systems. The basic search functionality test worked correctly, finding 3 Sondheim-related results that actually contained 'sondheim' in the content, which confirms the search mechanism is now working properly. However, the code encountered a Python variable error ('name 'content_text' is not defined') during the main Sondheim revue research phase, which prevented completion of the **PLAN** objectives. **PLAN** alignment: 25% - search functionality was verified and basic structure implemented, but the main research phases for identifying theatre company connections between Sondheim revues and Baroness Orczy adaptations were not completed due to the variable error. The code successfully created the research framework and saved initial test results to workspace files. Recommended fix: Correct the undefined variable error in the result analysis section (likely 'content_text' should be 'combined_text' or similar), then re-run the search phases to complete the Sondheim revue and Orczy adaptation research as intended in the **PLAN**.
Python Code python
# Complete fresh start to eliminate contamination issues # Testing basic search functionality first before proceeding with main objective print('=== TESTING SEARCH FUNCTIONALITY - FRESH ENVIRONMENT ===') print('Objective: Verify search works before attempting Sondheim-Orczy research') print('This will test if DDGS is working properly without contamination\n') import os import json import time # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Test basic search functionality first print('=== STEP 1: BASIC SEARCH FUNCTIONALITY TEST ===') print('=' * 60) try: from ddgs import DDGS print('‚úÖ DDGS import successful') # Create fresh searcher instance test_searcher = DDGS(timeout=15) print('‚úÖ DDGS searcher created') # Simple test search to verify functionality test_query = 'Stephen Sondheim composer' print(f'\nTesting basic search with: "{test_query}"') test_results = test_searcher.text( test_query, max_results=3, backend=["google"], region="en-us" ) if test_results: print(f'‚úÖ Basic search working - found {len(test_results)} results') # Verify results actually contain Sondheim sondheim_found = False for i, result in enumerate(test_results, 1): title = result.get('title', '').lower() body = result.get('body', '').lower() print(f' Test Result {i}: {result.get("title", "No title")[:50]}...') if 'sondheim' in title or 'sondheim' in body: sondheim_found = True print(f' ‚úÖ Contains "sondheim" - search working correctly') else: print(f' ‚ùå No "sondheim" found - potential contamination') if sondheim_found: print('\nüéØ SEARCH FUNCTIONALITY VERIFIED - Proceeding with main objective') else: print('\n‚ùå SEARCH CONTAMINATION DETECTED - All results lack target terms') else: print('‚ùå No results returned from test search') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error in basic search test: {str(e)}') print('Cannot proceed with contaminated search environment') print('\n=== STEP 2: PROCEEDING WITH SONDHEIM REVUE RESEARCH ===') print('=' * 70) # Initialize clean research structure sondheim_orczy_research = { 'research_date': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find theatre companies that staged both Sondheim revues and Baroness Orczy adaptations', 'search_status': 'clean_start', 'sondheim_findings': [], 'orczy_findings': [], 'theatre_connections': [] } # Define specific Sondheim revues to research target_revues = [ 'Putting It Together', 'Side by Side by Sondheim', 'Marry Me a Little' ] print(f'Researching {len(target_revues)} Stephen Sondheim revues:') for i, revue in enumerate(target_revues, 1): print(f' {i}. {revue}') # Search for each Sondheim revue for revue_name in target_revues: print(f'\n--- Researching "{revue_name}" ---') try: # Create specific search query for this revue search_query = f'Stephen Sondheim "{revue_name}" musical revue theatre production' print(f'Query: {search_query}') # Execute search revue_results = test_searcher.text( search_query, max_results=4, backend=["google", "duckduckgo"], region="en-us" ) if revue_results: print(f'‚úÖ Found {len(revue_results)} results for {revue_name}') # Analyze each result for relevance relevant_results = [] for i, result in enumerate(revue_results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') description = result.get('body', '') url = result.get('href', '') # Check if result is actually about this Sondheim revue content_text = f'{title} {description}'.lower() has_sondheim = 'sondheim' in content_text has_revue_name = revue_name.lower() in content_text has_theatre = any(term in content_text for term in ['theatre', 'theater', 'production', 'cast']) print(f' Result {i}: {title[:60]}...') print(f' Sondheim: {"‚úÖ" if has_sondheim else "‚ùå"}, Revue: {"‚úÖ" if has_revue_name else "‚ùå"}, Theatre: {"‚úÖ" if has_theatre else "‚ùå"}') if has_sondheim and (has_revue_name or has_theatre): print(f' üéØ RELEVANT - Adding to research') relevant_results.append({ 'revue_name': revue_name, 'title': title, 'description': description[:200], 'url': url, 'relevance_score': sum([has_sondheim, has_revue_name, has_theatre]) }) else: print(f' ‚ùå NOT RELEVANT - Skipping') if relevant_results: print(f'\nüìä {len(relevant_results)} relevant results found for {revue_name}') sondheim_orczy_research['sondheim_findings'].extend(relevant_results) # Save individual revue results revue_filename = f'{revue_name.lower().replace(" ", "_")}_research.json' revue_filepath = os.path.join('workspace', revue_filename) with open(revue_filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'revue_name': revue_name, 'search_query': search_query, 'relevant_results': relevant_results, 'total_found': len(revue_results) }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'üìÅ Results saved to: {revue_filename}') else: print(f'‚ùå No relevant results for {revue_name}') else: print(f'‚ùå No search results returned for {revue_name}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error researching {revue_name}: {str(e)}') # Pause between searches time.sleep(2) print(f'\nüìä Sondheim research complete: {len(sondheim_orczy_research["sondheim_findings"])} relevant findings') print('\n=== STEP 3: BARONESS ORCZY ADAPTATIONS RESEARCH ===') print('=' * 70) # Research Baroness Orczy theatrical adaptations orczy_searches = [ 'Baroness Orczy "Scarlet Pimpernel" musical theatre', '"The Scarlet Pimpernel" Broadway musical world premiere', 'Orczy "Scarlet Pimpernel" stage adaptation theatre company' ] for i, orczy_query in enumerate(orczy_searches, 1): print(f'\n--- Orczy Search {i}: {orczy_query} ---') try: orczy_results = test_searcher.text( orczy_query, max_results=4, backend=["google", "duckduckgo"], region="en-us" ) if orczy_results: print(f'‚úÖ Found {len(orczy_results)} results') # Analyze for Orczy relevance relevant_orczy = [] for j, result in enumerate(orczy_results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') description = result.get('body', '') url = result.get('href', '') content_text = f'{title} {description}'.lower() has_orczy = 'orczy' in content_text or 'baroness' in content_text has_pimpernel = 'pimpernel' in content_text or 'scarlet' in content_text has_theatre = any(term in content_text for term in ['theatre', 'theater', 'musical', 'broadway', 'stage']) print(f' Result {j}: {title[:60]}...') print(f' Orczy: {"‚úÖ" if has_orczy else "‚ùå"}, Pimpernel: {"‚úÖ" if has_pimpernel else "‚ùå"}, Theatre: {"‚úÖ" if has_theatre else "‚ùå"}') if (has_orczy or has_pimpernel) and has_theatre: print(f' üéØ RELEVANT - Adding to research') relevant_orczy.append({ 'adaptation_type': 'Baroness Orczy work', 'title': title, 'description': description[:200], 'url': url, 'search_query': orczy_query, 'relevance_score': sum([has_orczy, has_pimpernel, has_theatre]) }) else: print(f' ‚ùå NOT RELEVANT - Skipping') if relevant_orczy: print(f'\nüìä {len(relevant_orczy)} relevant Orczy results found') sondheim_orczy_research['orczy_findings'].extend(relevant_orczy) else: print(f'‚ùå No relevant Orczy results in search {i}') else: print(f'‚ùå No results returned for Orczy search {i}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error in Orczy search {i}: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) print(f'\nüìä Orczy research complete: {len(sondheim_orczy_research["orczy_findings"])} relevant findings') # Save comprehensive research results final_research_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'sondheim_orczy_theatre_research_final.json') with open(final_research_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(sondheim_orczy_research, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH SAVED TO: {os.path.basename(final_research_file)}') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('SONDHEIM REVUES & BARONESS ORCZY THEATRE CONNECTIONS - FINAL SUMMARY') print('=' * 80) print(f'üìä RESEARCH STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Sondheim revue findings: {len(sondheim_orczy_research["sondheim_findings"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Orczy adaptation findings: {len(sondheim_orczy_research["orczy_findings"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Search status: {sondheim_orczy_research["search_status"]}') if sondheim_orczy_research['sondheim_findings']: print(f'\nüé≠ SONDHEIM REVUES FOUND:') revue_names = list(set([f['revue_name'] for f in sondheim_orczy_research['sondheim_findings']])) for revue in revue_names: count = len([f for f in sondheim_orczy_research['sondheim_findings'] if f['revue_name'] == revue]) print(f' ‚Ä¢ {revue}: {count} relevant sources') # Show sample source sample = next(f for f in sondheim_orczy_research['sondheim_findings'] if f['revue_name'] == revue) print(f' Sample: {sample["title"][:60]}...') if sondheim_orczy_research['orczy_findings']: print(f'\nüè∞ ORCZY ADAPTATIONS FOUND:') for i, finding in enumerate(sondheim_orczy_research['orczy_findings'][:3], 1): print(f' {i}. {finding["title"][:60]}...') print(f' Score: {finding["relevance_score"]}/3') print(f'\nüéØ NEXT STEPS FOR FINDING THEATRE CONNECTIONS:') print('1. üîç Analyze saved research files for specific theatre company names') print('2. üìö Cross-reference production histories of identified theatre companies') print('3. üèõÔ∏è Focus on major musical theatre companies (Roundabout, Manhattan Theatre Club, etc.)') print('4. ‚úÖ Verify which companies have produced both Sondheim revues and Orczy adaptations') print('\n=== CLEAN SONDHEIM-ORCZY RESEARCH COMPLETE ===')
